cluster_relations.rel_desc: Cinderella is presented as an individual fairytale belonging to the broader category of fairytales.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a specific instance or individual example of the object class or category.
remarks: Modeled as instance-of to capture that Cinderella is a member of the fairytale genre.
Modeled as instance-of to capture that Cinderella is a member of the fairytale genre.
Modeled as instance-of to capture that Cinderella is a member of the fairytale genre.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Snow White is treated as an individual instance of a fairytale.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a specific instance or individual example of the object class or category.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Hansel and Gretel is treated as an individual fairytale.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a specific instance or individual example of the object class or category.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: "These tales" refers to the specific named stories, which are a subset of the broader category of fairytales.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject collection or group is a subset of, or fully contained within, the object collection or category.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: ReferentScope: Brothers Grimm collection and the listed classic stories

remarks: Relation created to anchor the anaphoric group 'these tales' within the fairytale genre.
Relation created to anchor the anaphoric group 'these tales' within the fairytale genre.
Relation created to anchor the anaphoric group 'these tales' within the fairytale genre.

args.justification: All four relations (three is_instance_of and one is_subset_of) encode taxonomic / set-theoretic inclusion between specific tales or tale-collections and the broader category 'fairytales'. This is better modeled as a classification hierarchy rather than pure IDENTITY. The existing canonical_rel_name values are already appropriate and need no change, but rel_cls should emphasize classification hierarchy, and rel_cls_group should reflect hierarchical inclusion rather than identity.
args.remark: Retains distinct predicates is_instance_of vs is_subset_of while aligning them under a common classification_hierarchy_relation class and broad HIERARCHY group.

executed_decisions.justification: All four relations (three is_instance_of and one is_subset_of) encode taxonomic / set-theoretic inclusion between specific tales or tale-collections and the broader category 'fairytales'. This is better modeled as a classification hierarchy rather than pure IDENTITY. The existing canonical_rel_name values are already appropriate and need no change, but rel_cls should emphasize classification hierarchy, and rel_cls_group should reflect hierarchical inclusion rather than identity.
executed_decisions.remark: Retains distinct predicates is_instance_of vs is_subset_of while aligning them under a common classification_hierarchy_relation class and broad HIERARCHY group.
